intro: Zygophyllum fruticulosum var. brevilobum, commonly known as the short-lobed jointvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant produces clusters of yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Zygophyllum fruticulosum var. brevilobum is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
